overview: BioMerieux S.A. engages in the design, development, manufacture, and marketing of diagnosis systems. The company specializes in three main areas: in vitro diagnostics, clinical diagnostics, and industrial microbiological control. The companyâ€™s in vitro diagnostics clinical applications include the diagnosis of infectious diseases, such as hepatitis, HIV, tuberculosis, and respiratory infections, as well as pathologies, such as cardiovascular diseases and cancers. Its industrial applications include analysis of industrial samples, including food, pharmaceutical, and cosmetic products or an environmental sample, such as water, air, and surface to determine its microbiological quality. BioMerieuxâ€™s clinical diagnostics are used in the detection of infectious diseases, cancer, cardiovascular pathologies, metabolic diseases, allergies, hormone disorders, and hematology. The company also offers various diagnostic systems, including reagents to conduct biological tests, such as the identification of a type of bacteria, virus, or the measurement of a hormone or marker; instruments used for automated testing; and software designed to process and interpret the results of biological tests. In addition, it provides a range of solutions for the food, pharmaceutical, and cosmetics industries in the fields of food safety, quality control, and traceability, as well as sterility controls, water controls, and environmental controls. It has strategic partnerships with Hitachi High-Technologies Corporation, Affymetrix Inc., Cepheid, ReLIA, Quidel Corporation, and DiagnoSwiss S.A. BioMerieux has operations in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, North America, Latin America, and the Asia Pacific. The company was formerly known as Institut Merieux and changed its name to BioMerieux S.A. in 1974. BioMerieux S. A. was founded in 1897 and is based in Marcy lâ€™Etoile, France.
